theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Oxidative Stress Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on ROS generated during mitochondrial metabolism causing cumulative damage and inflammation driving aging.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights mitochondrial protein oxidative damage accumulation and caloric restriction effects on aging.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial dysfunction, redox imbalance, antioxidant enzyme decline, and chronic inflammation in aging.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial ROS generation, antioxidant enzyme decline, and oxidative damage accumulation driving aging.

theory_assignments.reasoning: General oxidative stress theory emphasizing ROS from cellular respiration causing macromolecular damage and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Oxidative Stress Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial ROS production, oxidative damage accumulation, antioxidant defense, and proteasome activity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Oxidative Stress Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights mitochondrial ROS production, redox homeostasis, antioxidant defense, and resistance to oxidative stress in longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Adaptation and Metabolic Rate Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on species with high metabolic rates evolving enhanced antioxidant defenses and repair mechanisms mitigating oxidative damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Adaptation and Metabolic Rate Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes antioxidant enzyme roles, exercise-induced adaptations, and genetic selection affecting oxidative damage and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Adaptation and Metabolic Rate Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on urate as a major antioxidant evolved in humans protecting against oxidative damage and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Adaptation and Metabolic Rate Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes activation of p38 MAPK and IIS pathways enhancing oxidative stress resistance and lifespan via antioxidant adaptation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Adaptation and Metabolic Rate Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on SKN-1/Nrf2 transcription factor mediating oxidative stress resistance and promoting longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Adaptation and Metabolic Rate Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes exercise-induced hormesis via redox signaling activating antioxidant defenses and mitochondrial remodeling.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Adaptation and Metabolic Rate Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on glutathione redox state shifts and protein thiolation affecting redox balance and aging rate.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: ROS Control Network and Redox Regulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes neuronal control of ROS production via ion fluxes, gerontogenes, and antioxidant proteins regulating oxidative stress.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: ROS Control Network and Redox Regulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on species differences in oxidative stress sensitivity and links to longevity via redox regulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: ROS Control Network and Redox Regulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights superoxide dismutase enzymes regulating ROS and genetic manipulation affecting lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: ROS Control Network and Redox Regulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes ROS accumulation, oxidative damage, and antioxidant enzyme roles in muscle proteostasis and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: ROS Control Network and Redox Regulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on MAO-B enzyme activity producing hydrogen peroxide causing oxidative stress and mitochondrial impairment in brain aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: ROS Control Network and Redox Regulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes failure of adaptive responses in muscle due to chronic ROS elevation and impaired redox-sensitive signaling.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: ROS Control Network and Redox Regulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative stress-induced neuromuscular junction degeneration and muscle fiber deficits causing sarcopenia.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress-Inflammation Interaction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Integrates chronic oxidative stress with inflammatory signaling pathways driving aging and age-related diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress-Inflammation Interaction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes oxidative stress as mechanism linking reproduction investment to somatic maintenance trade-offs and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress-Inflammation Interaction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Mitohormesis hypothesis where mild mitochondrial ROS act as beneficial signals inducing stress defenses and longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress-Inflammation Interaction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on redox signaling disruption and oxidative stress contributing to cognitive decline and aging-related functional impairments.
